[[John Ridgway (comics)|John Ridgway]] |alliances=[[S.H.I.E.L.D.]] |aliases= |powers=*Skilled martial artist *Weapon proficiency ||species=Human}} The '''Agent''' ('''Rick Mason''') is a [[character (arts)|fictional character]] appearing in [[American comic books]] published by [[Marvel Comics]]. Created by [[James Hudnall]] and [[John Ridgway (comics)|John Ridgway]], the character first appeared in ''Marvel Graphic Novel: Rick Mason, The Agent'' #1 (December, 1989). [[O.T. Fagbenle|O-T Fagbenle]] portrayed Mason in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] film ''[[Black Widow (2021 film)|Black Widow]]'' (2021). ==Publication history== {{expand section|date=December 2020}} Rick Mason was created by [[James Hudnall]] and [[John Ridgway (comics)|John Ridgway]] and made his debut in ''Marvel Graphic Novel: Rick Mason, The Agent'' #1 (December, 1989).{{Cite web |last=Meyer |first=Joshua |date=2022-04-04 |title=O-T Fagbenle's Black Widow Character Might Return In Future Projects [Exclusive] - /Film |url=https://www.slashfilm.com/821745/o-t-fagbenles-black-widow-character-might-return-in-future-projects-exclusive/ |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=SlashFilm.com |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |last=Nolan |first=Liam |date=2022-04-05 |title=Black Widow Star Shares Vague Details About Their MCU Future |url=https://www.cbr.com/black-widow-o-t-fagbenle-teases-mcu-future/ |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=CBR |language=en-US}} ==Fictional character biography== Rick Mason served as a mercenary who specialized in the non-lethal handling of superhumans, having grown up exposed to advanced technology necessary for such tasks as the son of the criminal inventor Phineas Mason, better known as the [[Tinkerer]].''Marvel Graphic Novel: Rick Mason, The Agent'' #1{{Cite web |last=Raymond |first=Charles Nicholas |date=2021-07-31 |title=Black Widow: Who Is Mason & How Does He Get So Much Stuff? |url=https://screenrant.com/black-widow-mason-identity-comics-backstory/ |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=ScreenRant |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |last=Newnum |first=Paul |date=2020-11-27 |title=Rick Mason: Who Is Spider-Man: Miles Morales Character? |url=https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-miles-morales-rick-mason-marvel-history/ |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=CBR |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |title=Spider-Man: Miles Morales: Who Is Rick Mason? |url=https://comicbook.com/gaming/news/spider-man-miles-morales-who-is-rick-mason/ |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=GAMING |language=en}} Mason became a highly trained covert operative due to the experience he gained working alongside individuals like [[Nick Fury]], Dennis Nayland, and Alexi Vazhin.''All-New Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z'' #1 He decided to become freelance, adopting the codename "The Agent," and has completed missions for the governments of many nations, including the [[United States]], [[Israel]], [[Japan]], and the [[United Kingdom]].{{Cite web |last=Schneiderman |first=Miles |date=2021-07-09 |title=Characters In Black Widow That Are More Important Than You Realized - Looper |url=https://www.looper.com/455518/characters-in-black-widow-that-are-more-important-than-you-realized/ |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=Looper.com |language=en-US}} Mason was once hired to kill an alleged mole code-named "Vitamin" from the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] in [[Berlin]].{{Cite web |last=Aberl |first=Joseph |date=2020-10-12 |title=Marvel Studios' 'Black Widow': Who is Rick Mason? |url=https://www.murphysmultiverse.com/marvel-studios-black-widow-who-is-rick-mason/ |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=Murphy's Multiverse |language=en-US}} In an attempt to kill him, Mason blew up a hotel, but he was under observation by Michael Rossi and [[Carol Danvers]], who tracked him across the city. Mason escaped using one of his father's devices to become invisible.''Ms. Marvel'' Vol 2 #33 His upbringing in New York City brought him into contact with many criminals due to his father's occupation.''The Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z'' Ill at ease with wrong-doers, the Agent sought a path in life other than aiding others in perpetrating crimes. Becoming a mercenary the Agent worked for [[S.H.I.E.L.D.]] though was later hired by the [[United Kingdom|British]] government to prevent the super team China Force from overthrowing their rule of [[Hong Kong]]. Returning to S.H.I.E.L.D., he was required by [[Nick Fury]] to undertake a similar mission in [[Costa Brava]] involving American-backed rebels. The Agent discovered that one of his former teachers, Teng Yun-Suan, was responsible for both of these incidents. Yun-Suan met death at the Agent's hands. As a freelance mercenary who specialized in non-lethal metahuman handlings, he assisted Nick Fury involving metahuman mercenaries.''Marvel Graphic Novel'' #57 The Agent remained on good terms with his father despite the latter making a living in a field he did not approve of. The [[Corporation (comics)|Corporation]] used this to their advantage and kidnapped the Agent to force the Tinkerer to work for them.''Cage'' #13. Marvel Comics.{{Cite web |last=Sonnack |first=Matthew |date=2021-07-16 |title=Black Widow's Rick Mason Has a Surprising Connection to a Spider-Man: Homecoming Villain |url=https://www.cbr.com/black-widow-rick-mason-spider-man-tinkerer-connection/ |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=CBR |language=en-US}} Mason encounters [[Luke Cage]] and [[Dakota North (comics)|Dakota North]] and the three defeat the Corporation. Unfortunately, Mason was apparently killed later on after which his activities as the anonymous Agent were public knowledge.''Cage'' #14. Marvel Comics. Mason's own son perished during [[Nitro (comics)|Nitro]]'s explosion in [[Stamford, Connecticut|Stamford]], [[Connecticut]] which heralded the [[Civil War (comics)|Civil War]]'s beginning.''Punisher War Journal'' vol. 2 #16 Mason later teamed up with [[Carol Danvers]], and the two learned about Ghazi Rashid now as a metahuman. After it's revealed that Rossi was Vitamin and Ms. Marvel gets overloaded with power, Mason almost dies from a bomb and only makes it out in time. He tracked Rossi to Brazil who he killed then spoke with [[Norman Osborn]] for his father's prison release, threatening death for Ms. Marvel's apparent death.''Ms. Marvel'' vol. 2 #33-37 == In other media == === Film === * [[O.T. Fagbenle]] portrays Rick Mason in the live-action [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] film ''[[Black Widow (2021 film)|Black Widow]]'' (2021).{{cite web|last1=N'Duka|first1=Amanda|last2=D'Alessandro|first2=Anthony|date=April 10, 2019|title=Marvel's 'Black Widow' Snares 'The Handmaid's Tale' Actor O-T Fagbenle|url=https://deadline.com/2019/04/black-widow-marvel-cast-handmaids-tale-actor-o-t-fagbenle-1202593084/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190410193616/https://deadline.com/2019/04/black-widow-marvel-cast-handmaids-tale-actor-o-t-fagbenle-1202593084/|archive-date=April 10, 2019|access-date=April 11, 2019|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]}} This version is an ally from [[Natasha Romanoff (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Natasha Romanoff]]'s past with [[S.H.I.E.L.D. (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]] and a romantic interest.{{Cite magazine |url=https://ew.com/comic-con/2019/07/20/black-widow-movie-first-look-scarlett-johansson/ |title=Black Widow hits Comic-Con with first details of Scarlett Johansson film |last=Coggan |first=Devan |date=July 20, 2019 |magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190721020135/https://ew.com/comic-con/2019/07/20/black-widow-movie-first-look-scarlett-johansson/ |archive-date=July 21, 2019 |access-date=July 20, 2019}} Fagbenle described Mason as "a finder for people who aren't so affiliated with armies".{{Cite web |url=https://comicbook.com/movies/news/black-widow-movie-natasha-mason-romance-ot-fagbenle/ |title=Black Widow Star Tease Natasha's Romance With Mysterious Mason |last=Lovett |first=Jamie |date=November 15, 2020 |website=ComicBook.com |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116143859/https://comicbook.com/movies/news/black-widow-movie-natasha-mason-romance-ot-fagbenle/|archive-date=November 16, 2020 |access-date=November 16, 2020}} * Rick Mason appears in the video game ''[[Spider-Man: Miles Morales]]'' (2020), voiced by [[Todd Williams (actor)|Todd Williams]].{{cite video game | title=Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales | developer= [[Insomniac Games]] | publisher=[[Sony Interactive Entertainment]] | date=November 12, 2020 | platform=[[PlayStation 4]] | scene=Credits}} This version was Phin Mason's older scientist brother and [[Miles Morales]]'s friend. Additionally, Rick worked for [[Roxxon]] and helped create the Nuform power source until he and his staff were diagnosed with [[bone marrow failure]]. With Phin's help, Rick tried to expose the truth, but was trapped and killed by Roxxon's R&D director Simon Krieger, who subsequently took credit for Rick's work.
